mouseTouchscreen.title: Using a Mouse/Touchscreen
mouseTouchscreen.content:
Let‚Äôs Play: Mouse & Touchscreen Basics

Ready to explore? Your mouse and touchscreen are your magic wands for the digital world!

Mouse Fun:

  • ‚Ä¢ Point: Move the mouse and watch the arrow follow you!
  • ‚Ä¢ Click: Press the left button to select things. Try clicking on a button below!
  • ‚Ä¢ Double Click: Quickly press twice to open files or programs.
  • ‚Ä¢ Right Click: Press the right button for a secret menu.
  • ‚Ä¢ Scroll: Roll the wheel to move up and down a page.

Touchscreen Tricks:

  • ‚Ä¢ Tap: Gently touch the screen to select.
  • ‚Ä¢ Swipe: Slide your finger to scroll or switch screens.
  • ‚Ä¢ Pinch: Move two fingers together or apart to zoom in and out.
  • ‚Ä¢ Long Press: Hold your finger down for more options (like right click!).

Try It Out!

  • ‚Ä¢ Move your mouse and see what changes on the screen.
  • ‚Ä¢ Tap and swipe on your device to explore.
keyPoints: The mouse pointer follows your hand!
Left click is your main action.
Touchscreens let you tap, swipe, and zoom!
mouseTouchscreen.practiceExercise: Try clicking, double-clicking, and right-clicking on your desktop. On a touchscreen, tap and swipe to move between screens.
mouseTouchscreen.animationDesc: Watch how to click, double-click, and swipe on a touchscreen.

deviceBasics.title: Device Basics
deviceBasics.description: Learn how to turn your device on and off safely
deviceBasics.content:
Turning Your Device On and Off

Every device has a power button. Let's learn how to use it safely.

For Computers:

  • ‚Ä¢ Look for a round button with a power symbol (‚èª)
  • ‚Ä¢ Press it once to turn on
  • ‚Ä¢ To turn off: Use the Start menu, then "Shut down"
  • ‚Ä¢ Never just press the power button to turn off!

For Phones/Tablets:

  • ‚Ä¢ Power button is usually on the side
  • ‚Ä¢ Press and hold for 2-3 seconds to turn on
  • ‚Ä¢ To turn off: Press and hold, then slide to power off
keyPoints: Always use proper shutdown procedures
Power button location varies by device
Never force power off unless absolutely necessary
deviceBasics.practiceExercise: Practice turning your device on and off 3 times using the proper method.
deviceBasics.animationDesc: Watch how to properly press the power button

mouseKeyboard.title: Using Mouse and Keyboard
mouseKeyboard.description: Master the basics of computer input devices
mouseKeyboard.content:
Mouse and Keyboard Basics

Mouse Basics:

  • ‚Ä¢ Left click: Select items, open programs
  • ‚Ä¢ Right click: Open menus with more options
  • ‚Ä¢ Double click: Open files and programs
  • ‚Ä¢ Scroll wheel: Move up and down on pages

Keyboard Essentials:

  • ‚Ä¢ Space bar: Add spaces between words
  • ‚Ä¢ Enter: Start a new line or confirm
  • ‚Ä¢ Backspace: Delete the letter before cursor
  • ‚Ä¢ Shift: Make capital letters
keyPoints: Left click is your main tool
Right click opens helpful menus
Practice makes perfect
mouseKeyboard.practiceExercise: Open a simple text program and type your name, then delete it using backspace.
mouseKeyboard.animationDesc: See how to click, double-click, and right-click

internetSafety.title: Internet Safety Fundamentals
internetSafety.description: Stay safe online with these essential tips
internetSafety.content:
Staying Safe Online

Warning Signs of Scams:

  • ‚Ä¢ Urgent messages asking for money
  • ‚Ä¢ Requests for passwords or personal info
  • ‚Ä¢ "You've won" messages you didn't enter
  • ‚Ä¢ Suspicious links or attachments

Safe Browsing Tips:

  • ‚Ä¢ Look for "https://" in web addresses
  • ‚Ä¢ Only download from official app stores
  • ‚Ä¢ Keep your software updated
  • ‚Ä¢ Use strong, unique passwords
keyPoints: Never give personal information to strangers
When in doubt, ask a trusted person
Legitimate companies won't ask for passwords via email
internetSafety.practiceExercise: Identify 3 warning signs of online scams from the lesson.

videoCalls.title: Video Calls with Family
videoCalls.description: Connect face-to-face with loved ones anywhere
videoCalls.content:
Making Video Calls

Popular Video Call Apps:

  • ‚Ä¢ FaceTime (iPhone/iPad): Built-in, very easy
  • ‚Ä¢ WhatsApp: Works on all phones
  • ‚Ä¢ Zoom: Great for group calls
  • ‚Ä¢ Skype: Works on computers and phones

Before Your Call:

  • ‚Ä¢ Check your internet connection
  • ‚Ä¢ Find good lighting (face a window)
  • ‚Ä¢ Test your camera and microphone
  • ‚Ä¢ Have the person's contact ready
keyPoints: Good lighting makes a big difference
Test your setup before important calls
Most apps work similarly once you learn one
videoCalls.practiceExercise: Make a test video call to a family member or friend.

socialMedia.title: Social Media Basics
socialMedia.description: Connect with friends and family on Facebook and other platforms
socialMedia.content:
Getting Started with Social Media

Facebook Basics:

  • ‚Ä¢ Create a profile with your real name
  • ‚Ä¢ Add a nice profile picture
  • ‚Ä¢ Send friend requests to people you know
  • ‚Ä¢ Share updates, photos, and memories

Privacy Settings:

  • ‚Ä¢ Only accept friends you actually know
  • ‚Ä¢ Set posts to "Friends only"
  • ‚Ä¢ Don't share personal information publicly
  • ‚Ä¢ Review what others can see about you
keyPoints: Privacy settings are very important
Only connect with people you know
Think before you post - it stays online
socialMedia.practiceExercise: Set up your privacy settings to "Friends only" for posts.

smartHome.title: Smart Home Devices
smartHome.description: Control your home with voice commands and apps
smartHome.content:
Smart Home Basics

Popular Smart Devices:

  • ‚Ä¢ Smart Speakers: Alexa, Google Home
  • ‚Ä¢ Smart Thermostats: Control temperature remotely
  • ‚Ä¢ Smart Lights: Dim, change colors, set schedules
  • ‚Ä¢ Smart Doorbells: See who's at the door

Getting Started:

  • ‚Ä¢ Start with one device to learn
  • ‚Ä¢ Download the device's app
  • ‚Ä¢ Follow setup instructions step by step
  • ‚Ä¢ Practice basic voice commands
keyPoints: Start simple with one device
Voice commands make life easier
Most devices have helpful apps
smartHome.practiceExercise: If you have a smart device, practice 3 different voice commands.

onlineBanking.title: Online Banking Security
onlineBanking.content:
Safe Online Banking

Security Essentials:

  • ‚Ä¢ Always type your bank's web address directly
  • ‚Ä¢ Look for the lock icon in your browser
  • ‚Ä¢ Never bank on public Wi-Fi
  • ‚Ä¢ Log out completely when finished

What You Can Do Online:

  • ‚Ä¢ Check account balances
  • ‚Ä¢ View transaction history
  • ‚Ä¢ Transfer money between accounts
  • ‚Ä¢ Pay bills electronically
keyPoints: Security is the top priority
Your bank will never ask for passwords via email
Online banking is very convenient when done safely
onlineBanking.practiceExercise: Visit your bank's website and practice logging in (don't do any transactions yet).

ourPromise.text: At Senior Tech Helper, we understand that your privacy is precious. We're committed to protecting your personal information and being completely transparent about how we use it. This policy explains everything in simple, clear language.

cookies.title: How We Use Cookies
cookies.whatAreCookiesText: Cookies are small text files that help us remember your preferences and make your experience better. Think of them like bookmarks that help us remember where you left off.
cookies.weUseCookiesForTitle: We use cookies ONLY to help you:
